About me

Hi !
My name is Tom Dinh.

Actually I got two names: Đinh Mạnh Hoàng is my Viet paper name legally. but people call me Tom, in Vietnamese writing is Tôm , it means a lobster/shrimp/prawn, it not short for Thomas like in English. In Thai, it means boiling process.

Ok, that's enough for my name. And this is my story.

I'm a developer, my coding journey starts in 2009 since I went to the university.

So, if you wonder why I become a code adventurer?.

Well, as a youngster like every youngster, I love computer games and video games. My first PC, which my parents gave me in 2005 is a heavy CRT secondhand PC with 20GB HDD, 256MB of RAM, Pentium IV first gen run Windows XP and a dial-up connection. That was a whole new world for me that time to start my adventure in IT world.

In high school, I learned to use the computer professionally, the first start with DOS Command lines and Windows then come to Pascal and C with Turbo Pascal, Borland Turbo C and FoxPro those are my first IDE ever. This time was simple I learned some code syntax as loops; switch; if and nested, just to solve some elementary algebra equations as Linear equation; Quadratic equation ...

From 2008 to 2015 at university, I learned VB; C#; Java; Javascript, HTML/CSS to develop some study projects using VB.Net Forms and PHP solutions such as Joomla, Wordpress. OpenCart and Prestashop. I sometimes use Eclipse for PHP project but Visual Studio is my best friend IDE since the VB.NET time, until today when I work with ASP.NET MVC and AngularJS.

 About This Page

This page was developed on a simple idea after I defined my own issue and the idea is the solution for my issue.

My issues are:

How do people know I'm a developer?. How can I express my craftsmanship?

If I build my own website, what about the cost for hosting and domain name? I'm working part time as a kitchenhand to chase my coding dream. Are there any free solutions for me?

I've been worked with a lot of PHP solutions such as WordPress, Joomla, OpenCart and Prestashop, but those projects do not make me recognized as a real coder.

Something was wrong!

So, I do meditate and make up my mind. I should develop something. The thing which I'm not only code something for me but also challenge myself.

OK. Let's get started.

As a dev, my favorite playground is GitHub and luckily GitHub team providers GitHub Pages a cool static website and 100% free. Whoa! This is extracted what I need. So, I make my hand dirty with Git CLI and GitHub Flow; play around with Jekyll; learn some Ruby; download some Gems, and challenge myself with Angular and Angular Material, I also host this page on clouds like Azure and AWS.

Voilà. Today, I proud to say I am a craftsman, I develop this pages. It's my playground as well as a blog to share with my technical issues and solutions I found.
Tom Dinh. Hosted by and . Powered by and
